definitions: at whatever time, no matter when
examples: Call me anytime if you need help
The library is open anytime during business hours

definitions: principles concerning the distinction between right and wrong behavior
examples: Different cultures have different views on morality
The book explores questions of morality and justice

definitions: long pipe for transporting oil, gas, or water over distances
system or process through which something is developed or supplied
examples: The oil pipeline runs for thousands of miles
Workers inspect the pipeline for leaks regularly
Several new products are in the development pipeline
The talent pipeline ensures future leadership

definitions: woman on her wedding day or just before and after the event
examples: The bride wore her grandmother's wedding dress
Friends threw a party for the bride-to-be

definitions: entrance to a room or building through a door
examples: She stood in the doorway waiting for guests
The doorway was too narrow for the furniture

definitions: point where two systems, subjects, or organizations meet and interact
examples: The user interface should be simple and intuitive
This device serves as an interface between computers

definitions: person who is learning a subject or skill
examples: Adult learners often balance work and education
Visual learners benefit from diagrams and charts

definitions: public building or room for gambling and entertainment
examples: The casino stays open twenty-four hours a day
Tourists flock to the famous casinos in Vegas

definitions: action of putting someone or something in a particular place
examples: Careful placement of furniture maximizes space
The agency handles job placement for graduates

definitions: long thin flexible string or rope made from twisted strands
flexible insulated cable used for electrical connections
examples: Tie the package with strong cord
The climber checked the safety cord carefully
Don't trip over the extension cord
The lamp cord needs to be replaced

definitions: way in which something is perceived or regarded
action of conceiving a child or becoming pregnant
examples: His conception of justice differs from mine
The project changed dramatically from its original conception
Conception occurs when sperm meets egg
The doctor calculated the date of conception

definitions: quality of bending easily without breaking or being able to change
examples: Yoga improves physical flexibility and balance
Workplace flexibility helps retain talented employees

definitions: mark, fault, or other imperfection that mars a substance or object
examples: The diamond has a tiny flaw visible under magnification
Every plan has flaws that need addressing

definitions: small lockable cupboard or compartment for personal belongings
examples: Students keep books in their school lockers
Gym members store clothes in the locker room

definitions: action of turning something to form a spiral shape
unexpected change or development in a story or situation
examples: Give the jar lid a firm twist to open it
She felt a painful twist in her ankle
The movie's plot twist surprised everyone
Life took an unexpected twist after graduation

definitions: words used as a magical charm or incantation
short period of time
examples: The witch cast a spell on the prince
Children love stories about magic spells
We had a cold spell last winter
She worked there for a spell before moving on

definitions: request made in an urgent and emotional manner
examples: The charity made a plea for donations
His plea for mercy moved the judge

definitions: commodity, article, or service brought in from abroad for sale
examples: The country relies heavily on food imports
Import taxes affect consumer prices

definitions: pile of objects, typically arranged one on top of another
examples: The stack of papers toppled over on the desk
She carried a stack of library books home

definitions: old or discarded articles that are considered useless
examples: Clear the junk out of the garage
One person's junk is another's treasure

definitions: vehicle with two wheels propelled by pedals
examples: She rides her bicycle to work every day
Children should wear helmets when riding bicycles

definitions: events that will necessarily happen to someone in the future
examples: She believed it was her destiny to become a doctor
No one can escape their destiny

definitions: immoral or wicked behavior or habit
tool with movable jaws for holding work firmly
examples: Gambling became his worst vice
The novel explores human vices and virtues
Secure the wood in the vice before cutting
The mechanic tightened the part in a vice

definitions: round solid figure with every point equidistant from center
particular area of activity, interest, or expertise
examples: The Earth is not a perfect sphere
Crystal spheres decorated the chandelier
She's an expert in her sphere of influence
Politics falls outside my sphere of knowledge

definitions: person or organization that provides funds for an activity or event
examples: The company sponsors local youth sports teams
Find sponsors to help fund the charity event

definitions: time when the sun disappears below the horizon in the evening
examples: They watched the beautiful sunset from the beach
The sky turned orange and pink at sunset

definitions: process of keeping financial accounts and preparing financial statements
examples: She studied accounting in college
Good accounting practices prevent financial errors

definitions: process of changing to suit different conditions or uses
examples: The movie is an adaptation of a famous novel
Desert animals show remarkable adaptation to heat

definitions: narrow beam of light or radiation
broad flat fish with a long tail
examples: Rays of sunlight streamed through the window
X-ray machines use electromagnetic rays
The stingray glided gracefully along the ocean floor
Manta rays are the largest ray species

definitions: sovereign ruler of an empire
examples: The emperor ruled over vast territories
Japan's emperor has a ceremonial role today

definitions: vehicle with four wheels pulled by horses or used for transport
examples: Pioneers traveled west in covered wagons
Children pulled their toys in a red wagon

definitions: journalist who writes regular articles for a newspaper or magazine
examples: The advice columnist answers reader questions weekly
Political columnists influence public opinion

definitions: area of land overgrown with dense tropical vegetation
examples: Monkeys swing through the jungle canopy
The explorer got lost in the Amazon jungle

definitions: number equal to a thousand billion or million million
examples: The national debt exceeds twenty trillion dollars
A trillion seconds equals about 31,688 years

definitions: light gentle wind
examples: A cool breeze blew in from the ocean
The curtains fluttered in the evening breeze

definitions: responsibility for a fault or wrong
examples: Don't put all the blame on one person
She accepted blame for the mistake

definitions: place where an event or meeting is held
examples: The wedding venue overlooks the lake
Choose a venue that accommodates all guests

definitions: violent disturbance by a crowd of people
examples: Police were called to control the riot
The riot caused extensive property damage

definitions: state of being separated from others or standing alone
examples: Long periods of isolation affect mental health
The patient requires isolation to prevent infection

definitions: raw material or primary product that can be bought and sold
examples: Oil remains a valuable commodity worldwide
Agricultural commodities include wheat and corn

definitions: action or state of being present at a place or event
examples: School attendance is mandatory for children
The conference had record attendance this year

definitions: small flap or strip attached to something for holding or manipulation
bill for payment, especially at a bar or restaurant
examples: Pull the tab to open the can
File folders have tabs for labeling
Put the drinks on my tab
The dinner tab came to over a hundred dollars

definitions: thick mixture of flour and liquid for baking
informal term for money
examples: Knead the dough for ten minutes
Pizza dough needs time to rise
He makes serious dough at his new job
They're rolling in dough since the business succeeded

definitions: long thin line or mark of different color or texture
continuous period of specified success or failure
examples: Lightning left a bright streak across the sky
Gray streaks appeared in his hair
The team's winning streak lasted ten games
She's on a lucky streak at the casino

definitions: fine, strong, soft fiber produced by silkworms
examples: The dress was made of pure silk
Silk scarves feel luxurious against the skin

definitions: state or fact of being similar or alike
examples: The similarity between twins amazed everyone
Note the similarities in their writing styles

definitions: thick slice of high-quality beef for grilling or frying
examples: Order the ribeye steak medium-rare
Marinate the steak before grilling

definitions: activity of moving rhythmically to music
examples: Dancing is great exercise and fun
The wedding reception featured hours of dancing

definitions: formal written request signed by many people appealing to authority
examples: Thousands signed the petition for change
The petition needs more signatures to be valid

definitions: process of taking air into and expelling it from the lungs
examples: Deep breathing helps reduce stress
The doctor checked his breathing with a stethoscope
